definition: to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Rather than dealing with your mail yourself, you can outsource the task.
sentences.chinese: 处理邮件的事你可以申请外援，不必亲自劳神。

sentences.english: And sometimes I don't want to bother explaining things to people who are quick to judge.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，我并不想劳神向那些轻易下结论的人解释。

sentences.english: The preparations of tables and fruit offerings are really time-consuming, why bother?
sentences.chinese: 摆放桌子及水果等贡品很花费时间，何必劳神呢？

sentences.english: This is the problem that will consume the next president.
sentences.chinese: 这是将使下一任总统劳神费力的问题。

sentences.english: I’m putting it on my list, so I won’t have to share.
sentences.chinese: 我已经把它放在我的列表中了，所以不用劳神分享了。

sentences.english: But don't bother to apply fora job there.
sentences.chinese: 但不要劳神去这家公司找工作了。

sentences.english: Why should be bother learning another language?
sentences.chinese: 我们干嘛还劳神学别的语言？

sentences.english: But don't bother to apply for a job there.
sentences.chinese: 但不要劳神去这家公司找工作了。

sentences.english: it's the only one the mainstream has bothered to acknowledge.
sentences.chinese: 这却是主流劳神费心认可的唯一看法。

definition: to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to worry/to be on one's mind
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
